@squirrelrehab I thought the same but I didnâ€™t ask about that. ğŸ¤·ğŸ¼â€â™‚ï¸
@2lowtech Yup. And they informed me of the data breach when it happened. But Iâ€™ve had 3 or 4 others as well. ğŸ¤·ğŸ¼â€â™‚ï¸

@rickg Yes, butâ€¦ Iâ€™ve received notifications about four similar breeches in the past year or so. I donâ€™t have enough information to blame any one of those companies. And it wouldnâ€™t do any good anyway. ;)

@mkizer Yup, thatâ€™s my thought to. Seriously, I wouldnâ€™t put money into an account I didnâ€™t open, for starters. And then for me to be sent the debit card; that doesnâ€™t help the scammers either. Whatever. Accounts frozen.
@theotherlinh My bad: I froze the report when I got home from the bank, not prior to.
@mojosd 2021 Honda PCX. Itâ€™s just enough bike for me, no more & no less. 100+ MPG as well.
@MultiMatt @googlechrome @chromeunboxed Nope, Iâ€™ve never seen that behavior. If it keeps happening, Iâ€™d report it so the devs can look into it.

First food stop for this n00b rider. Not the best choice but itâ€™ll do! https://t.co/XhjVVPiLrJ
So although I would have taken a ride in the nice weather regardless, I actually had a VERY interesting, and unnerving, reason to make a 20 mile trek today. Last week I got an email from a bank saying â€œCongrats on opening your new checking accountâ€. Except I donâ€™t use that bank.
I figured it was a phishing scam, so I deleted the email. This week, I got an actual debit card for my new checking account at this bank. That freaked me out. So today, I rode out to the closest branch of the bank; Iâ€™m not naming it because it doesnâ€™t matter to the story.
I got to the bank this afternoon and a teller asked if she could help me. I explained that I received a debit card but I donâ€™t bank here. She shouted out â€œWe got another oneâ€¦.â€ Apparently, I wasnâ€™t the first person to have this happen to recently.
I was taken to an office with a bank rep and she explained to me that this has been happening a lot lately. She asked if she could take the debit card, which of course, I said yes. She cut it up after looking my license to verify I was who I said I was.
Then I asked â€œWhat information was tied to the checking account that I didnâ€™t open?â€ We went through it all. When the account was opened they used my name, address, my sonâ€™s phone number (weird) and hereâ€™s the kicker: My exact social security number.
Needless to say, this is not good. Iâ€™ve already frozen my credit reports but itâ€™s very disconcerting that my SS is out there. Nothing I can do now but watch my credit, which shouldnâ€™t have any changes due to freezing the account butâ€¦. WOW.
@boundzy98 Wait, itâ€™s a competition? Iâ€™m going to have to start trying harder now! ğŸ¤ª
@davewiner I read religiously sometime between 12:01 and 3:00am. ;) Between your effort and Typefully, I too wonder what Twitter will do (if anything) in regards to RSS.
Interesting: I see it creates a RSS feed for the tweets as well. I know someone who is interested in this feature specifically but I wonâ€™t name names. ğŸ˜‰ https://t.co/qDhLykR370

@WarnerCrocker @HouseGOP I hear you. But as a registered independent, I try (sometimes too hard, I admit) to have an open mind and see the differing POV. This was just too far for me to keep quiet during a very turbulent time.

I get that @HouseGOP thinks it's "owning the libs" with this. What it fails to realize (or even worse, does realize and ignores) is that a unified country & world suffers from this tripe. You do you GOP, but really: tone it down a notch by understanding you're not helping here. https://t.co/5GiKxUaobb
